@graph.name: Data analytics for engineering data using machine learning
@graph.description:
As part of the EXCELLERAT training program, Fraunhofer SCAI offers a workshop on data analytics for engineering data using machine learning.

The workshop day consists of two parts:

  1. In the morning part an introductory training on machine learning topics like clustering and dimension reduction techniques is provided. Brief hands-on exercises in python will aid the understanding of the material. 
  2. The second part will take place in the afternoon and will specifically deal with applying the machine learning methods from the first part to numerical simulation data stemming from engineering tasks. The SCAI DataViewer will assist the participants in analysing the provided simulation data sets. 



This first instance of this workshop will be open for all partners and corresponding institutes of EXCELLERAT.

  2. The second part will take place in the afternoon and will specifically deal with applying the machine learning methods from the first part to numerical simulation data stemming from engineering tasks. @graph.name: Iterative Solvers for Linear Systems @ HLRS
@graph.description:
The focus of the course is on modern iterative solvers for large linear systems of equations. Thereby, beside classical schemes and fundamentals of multigrid techniques different modern Krylov subspace methods (CG, GMRES, BiCGSTAB ...) as well as highly efficient preconditioning techniques are presented in the context of real life applications. Hands-on sessions (MATLAB and GNU Octave respectively) will allow users to immediately test and understand the basic constructs of iterative solvers. This course provides scientific training in Computational Science, and in addition, the scientific exchange of the participants among themselves. It is organized by HLRS, IAG, and Uni. Kassel.

The guest lecture on Day 2 is offered in collaboration with **HiDALGO**, the EU Centre of Excellence for Global Challenges. The method exposed is used in the HiDALGO **Social Network Pilot**.

@graph.name: Short course on HPC-based Computational Bio-Medicine
@graph.description:
**Objectives:** The objetive of this course is to give a panorama on the use of HPC-based computational mechanics in Engineering and Environment through the projects BSC are carrying on. This panorama includes the basics of what is behind the main tools: computational mechanics and parallelization. The training is delivered in collaboration with the center of excellence CompBioMed.

**Learning outcomes:** The course gives a wide perspective and the latest trends of how HPC helps in industrial, clinical and research applications allowing to achieve more realistic multiphysics simulations. In addition, the student has the opportunity of running Jobs in Marenostrum supercomputer.

**Level:** INTERMEDIATE: For trainees with some theoretical and practical knowledge

@graph.name: First joint CoEs Technical Workshop
@graph.description:
This event, which takes place on 27-29 January 2021, is open to HiDALGO, ChEESE and EXCELLERAT partners. Members of other CoEs may also participate.
